description: Unique identifier for the queued system message.
Recipient phone number for SMS/voice notifications; optional when using email only.
Primary recipient email address(es); may include multiple addresses separated by delimiters.
Code indicating message category, medium, or priority; meanings are system-specific and should be confirmed with an SME.
Subject line or title displayed to message recipients.
Message body/content, often HTML-formatted, delivered to recipients.
Timestamp when the message record was created in the queue.
Boolean indicating whether the message was successfully dispatched.
Number of failed delivery attempts for this message.
Most recent error details returned by the delivery service when sending failed.
Timestamp of the most recent delivery failure.
CC recipient email address(es) included with the message.
Timestamp when the message was successfully sent; null if pending or failed.
Originating module or process that generated the message.
Short code for notification category or audience; likely implementation-specific; confirm with SME.
Programmatic code identifying the notification event or template used.
Temporary file name or path for a generated attachment; likely used during send; confirm with SME.
Identifier of a report definition used to generate message content or attachments; confirm with SME.
Saved query or SQL used to produce report data for this message; confirm with SME.
User account associated with creating or triggering the message (e.g., sender or process owner).
